metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5804 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
A type confusion error within the "identify()" function (internal/dcraw_common.cpp) in LibRaw versions prior to 0.18.8 can be exploited to trigger a division by zero.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5804` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.18.8-1ubuntu0.1
libraw16 - 0.18.8-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: darktable: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
